isis.stitle: Recall 99509 - Cross Member Interference with ABS ECU on 3800 Models

recall.subject: Cross Member Interference with ABS ECU on 3800 Models

defect.para: This Recall applies to 3800 model buses with a 100 gallon between-the-rails fuel tank mounted behind the rear axle and a 276 inch wheel base built 4/2/98 through 5/6/99.

The ABS ECU interfered with the cross member mounted behind the rear axle and in front of the between-the-rails fuel tank. Vehicles may have been built by either eliminating or relocating the cross member, or moving the ECU as needed. If the cross member is either missing or relocated, the vehicle may not have adequate fuel tank protection. In the event of a vehicular accident, decreased fuel tank protection may result in a fuel tank intrusion which may cause fuel leakage leading to increased potential for property damage, personal injury, death or all of these.

Navistar will notify owners of this campaign on their vehicles. A listing of owner names and addresses has been furnished to the involved dealers to enable dealers to follow up with owners to have the vehicles corrected. You must limit the use of this listing to this campaign since the list may contain information obtained from state motor vehicle registration records and the use of such motor vehicle registration data for purposes other than this campaign is a violation of law in several states.

svcproc.title: SERVICE PROCEDURE FOR AIR SUSPENSION VEHICLES

para.emph: Before starting to perform the service repair, please read and understand the following instructions completely.

warning.para: To prevent serious eye injury, always wear safe eye protection when you perform vehicle maintenance or service.

Block the wheels to prevent the vehicle from moving. Support the vehicle with safety stands. Do not work under a vehicle supported only by jacks. Jacks can slip or fall over resulting in serious personal injury or death.

figure.caption: Air Suspension: Top View Showing Cross Members and Relocated ECU Mounting Location
Air Suspension: Left Side View Showing Cross Members and Relocated ECU Mounting Location

step1.para: Make sure there is a cross member in front of the fuel tank mounted with the flat flange down and bowed towards the fuel tank as shown in Figure 1 and Figure 2.

step2.para: If the cross member is correctly installed proceed to Step 2 below.

If the cross member is not installed correctly, then remove it and install it as shown in Figure 1 and Figure 2 with the flat flange down and bowed towards the fuel tank. Torque nuts to 100 - 120 ft-lbs.
If there is no cross member, then install one as shown in Figure 1 and Figure 2 using six 1/2-20 X 1 3/4 bolts (414053C1) and six 1/2 -20 nuts (414087C1). Torque nuts to 100 - 120 ft-lbs.
It may be necessary to relocate the ECU to the location shown in Figure 2 before the cross member can be installed.

step3.para: If the ECU is relocated it may be necessary to shorten the air lines.
For ECU's with Threaded Push-to-Connect fittings mount the ECU and shorten the air lines so that the hoses will not droop below the bottom flange of the frame rail. Reuse all fittings.

For ECU's with Compression fittings mount the ECU and shorten the air lines so that the hoses will not droop below the bottom flange of the frame rail. Reconnect the hoses to the ECU/Relay Valve using a new sleeve and insert for each hose. The fitting and nut may be re-used. For a 5/8 hose use sleeve p/n 2007992C1 and insert p/n 414508C1. For a 3/8 hose use sleeve p/n 2007990C1 and insert p/n 414505C1.

step2.para: If the ECU is relocated make sure that any excess wire in the harness is properly secured (tie strapped).

step1.para: Verify that the double dog bone cross members are installed correctly as shown in Figure 1 and Figure 2 with the flat flanges down.

step2.para: If the double dog bone cross member is not installed correctly, then remove and re-install it correctly as shown in Figure 1 and Figure 2 with the flat flanges down. Torque nuts to 100 - 120 ft-lbs.

responuscan.para:
Proceed immediately to make necessary correction to units in inventory. All inventory vehicles subject to this recall campaign must be corrected prior to sale, transfer or delivery.
If vehicles have been sold or transferred and you are in receipt of Customer Notification Letters and Authorization for Recall Service cards for those vehicles, transfer location or customer must be notified IMMEDIATELY from your dealer location.
Dealers must correct all vehicles subject to this campaign at no charge to the owner, regardless of mileage, age of vehicle, or ownership, from this time forward.

The National Traffic and Motor Vehicle Safety Act, as amended, provides that each vehicle that is subject to a vehicle recall campaign must be adequately repaired within a reasonable time after the owner has tendered it for repair. A failure to adequately repair within 60 days after a tender of a vehicle is prima facie evidence of failure to repair within a reasonable time. If the condition is not adequately repaired within 60 days, the owner may be entitled to replacement with an identical or reasonable equivalent vehicle at no charge, or to a refund of the purchase price less a reasonable allowance for depreciation.
However, consistent with the customer notification, dealers are expected to complete the repairs on the mutually agreed upon service date.

In order to avoid having to replace an owner's vehicle or refund the purchase price, every effort must be made to promptly schedule an appointment with each owner to repair their vehicle as soon as possible.
